title: The 6 Best Herbal Medicine Apps and Online Resources
author: Sean Mitchell
description: If you're interested in herbal medicine, you'll find plenty of apps and resources out there.
cleaned_text: has been a staple of natural healing for thousands of years, and with the advent of technology, it has never been easier to explore the world of herbal medicine. Whether you're a seasoned practitioner or just starting, there's something for everyone to learn in the ever-growing world of herbalism. Let's look at some of the most popular and useful online resources and mobile applications related to herbal medicine, and how they can help you on your journey to wellness. 1. [Handbook of Natural Medicine](https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/7251228/type/dlg/sid/UUmuoUeUpU2021540/https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mobisystems.msdict.embedded.wireless.elsevier.naturalmedicine) One popular mobile application for those interested in herbal medicine is the Handbook of Natural Medicine. This comprehensive app serves as a reference guide to a wide range of ailments and the natural treatments that you can use. It is an indispensable tool for anyone looking to incorporate botanical medicine into their wellness regimen. The sole and defining feature is the extensive database of common ailments. You can browse through common health issues, such as hypertension, and find relevant information on therapeutic considerations, related nutrition, and botanical medicine. This information is presented in a straightforward, concise format, making it easy to find what you're looking for. Additionally, the Handbook of Natural Medicine is powered by [Elsevier](https://www.elsevier.com/), a publishing company specializing in scientific, technical, and medical content. This means the app is updated with the latest information and research, giving you relative confidence that the information you're accessing is accurate and up to date, and peace of mind when making decisions about your wellness. 2. [The Herb Academy](https://theherbalacademy.com/) Another popular online resource for those interested in herbal medicine is The Herbal Academy. This comprehensive website offers a wealth of information and resources for both beginners and experienced herb aficionados alike. One of the key focus areas of The Herbal Academy is educational content. The site offers a wide range of classes and workshops on herbal medicine, from the basics to more advanced topics. The classes are taught by experienced herbalists and are designed to be accessible and easy to understand, making them a great resource for anyone. The Herbal Academy also features a robust blog that covers a wide range of topics related to herbal medicine—from how to make your own herbal remedies to the latest research on natural remedies. The blog is a valuable resource for anyone looking to stay up-to-date on all things herbal. You may also want to pick up one of [the best hydroponic indoor gardens](https://www.makeuseof.com/best-hydroponic-indoor-gardens/) to start growing your own herbs. 3. [Herbs Encyclopedia](https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/7251228/type/dlg/sid/UUmuoUeUpU2021540/https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.e_steps.herbs) If you're looking for a mobile-friendly resource on herbal medicine, the Herbs Encyclopedia app is worth checking out. This app provides you with a comprehensive guide to the world of herbal medicine. The Herbs Encyclopedia includes an extensive database of herbs that you can easily browse through. It lists common (and not-so-common) herbs and provides information on their uses, benefits, and potential side effects. In addition to the database of herbs, the app also includes a section on common health issues, such as warts, general fatigue, and migraines, and provides insights into the kinds of herbs, foods, and other plants that you might consider using to improve your wellbeing. You might get so familiar with plants you may no longer need to you one of the [many favorite plant identifier apps](https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/identify-plants-flowers-phone-camera/). Whether you're on the go or at home, this app provides you with access to important information on herbal medicine anytime, anywhere. 4. [Natural Medicines](https://naturalmedicines.therapeuticresearch.com/) The Natural Medicines website claims to be "The most authoritative resource available on dietary supplements, natural medicines, and complementary alternative and integrative therapies". One of the key features is the database of natural products, which are organized into categories such as [Sports Medicine](https://naturalmedicines.therapeuticresearch.com/databases/sports-medicine.aspx) and [Health & Wellness](https://naturalmedicines.therapeuticresearch.com/databases/health-wellness.aspx). Information on the site is based on the latest scientific research and is regularly updated, making it a reliable and trustworthy source of information. Another benefit of Natural Medicines is the Tools section (note: you must subscribe to access several of the subsections). Here you can access the Interaction Checker, the Effectiveness Checker, and the Adverse Effects Checker. You can even review dietary supplements that have been issued ingredient advisories by the Federal Drug Administration. Whether you're looking for information on a specific natural remedy or simply want to explore the world of natural health, Natural Medicines is a great place to start. 5. [Natural Remedies: healthy life](https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/7251228/type/dlg/sid/UUmuoUeUpU2021540/https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kaleidosstudio.natural_remedies) The Natural Remedies: healthy life app is the perfect tool for anyone looking to incorporate a more natural approach to wellness into their daily life. This app is a comprehensive guide to natural remedies for common illnesses, healthy recipes, and tips for a healthy lifestyle. The app includes information about the properties and benefits of different plants, fruits, and essential oils, as well as natural skincare and beauty tips. It also includes information about essential oils and how you can use them to treat different conditions, such as anxiety, insomnia, and poor concentration. The app also has a recipe section, a section on practicing yoga, a section on chromotherapy, which is based on the color method to induce relaxation before bed, and a section with sounds and calming music to soothe the mind and body. The Natural Remedies app really is a one-stop shop for health and wellness! 6. [LearningHerbs](https://learningherbs.com/) LearningHerbs is a treasure trove of information for those who are interested in learning about the use of herbs for health and wellness. The site features articles, tutorials, and online courses designed to help you create your own herbal remedies. The site has several sections, one of which includes online courses to help you get started with using herbs, how to harvest wild plants, and how to make your own remedies. In addition, LearningHerbs offers access to something called herbmentor, a subscription-based learning platform that features video tutorials from its herbal course library. Also, if you're into wild foraging, there are [several other resources to expand your palate](https://www.makeuseof.com/wild-foraging-resources/). The LearningHerbs store offers products that any budding herbalist would find valuable—including a starter [Herbal Remedy Kit](https://learningherbs.com/herbal-kit) and even board games that teach edible plants and healing herbs. Using Herbs to Explore Wellness Options Whether you are a beginner or an experienced practitioner, these resources offer a wealth of information and resources that can help you learn about the benefits of using herbs for health and wellness. Keep in mind that it's important to note that none of these resources are a substitute for professional medical or health advice, examination, diagnosis, or treatment.
